skill.name: ai-code-cleanup
skill.description: Remove AI-generated code slop from branches. Use after AI-assisted coding sessions to clean up defensive bloat, unnecessary comments, type casts, and style inconsistencies. Focuses on identifying and removing AI artifacts that degrade code quality.
skill.summary: Remove AI-generated code slop from branches. Use after AI-assisted coding sessions to clean up defen...
skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. SKILL.md and refactoring-plan.template.md are markdown files only. No scripts, network calls, file system access, environment variables, or external commands detected.

content.value_statement: AI-assisted coding often introduces defensive bloat, unnecessary comments, and style inconsistencies. This skill identifies and removes these artifacts to produce cleaner, more maintainable code while preserving functionality.
actual_capabilities: Cleans up redundant and obvious comments
Fixes unnecessary type casts and workarounds
limitations: Does not execute code or run tests automatically
Requires user to review and apply suggested changes
Cannot fix logic errors or architectural issues
Relies on existing project style conventions

use_cases.title: Post-AI coding cleanup
use_cases.description: Clean up code after AI-assisted sessions before commits or code reviews

use_cases.title: Review preparation
use_cases.description: Standardize code style and remove bloat before reviewing pull requests

use_cases.title: Quality gate enforcement
use_cases.description: Maintain consistent code quality standards across AI-assisted contributions

prompt_templates.title: Clean full branch
prompt_templates.scenario: Remove AI slop from entire branch
prompt_templates.prompt: Remove AI slop from this branch. Identify and remove defensive bloat, unnecessary comments, type casts, and style inconsistencies that do not affect functionality.

prompt_templates.title: Target specific files
prompt_templates.prompt: Remove unnecessary comments and defensive code from src/. Focus on AI-generated artifacts while preserving all error handling and functionality.

prompt_templates.title: Prepare for review
prompt_templates.prompt: Clean up the code in this pull request. Remove AI artifacts, standardize style to match the codebase, and eliminate defensive bloat while maintaining behavior.

prompt_templates.title: Quality assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this code for AI-generated artifacts. List all unnecessary comments, defensive patterns, type workarounds, and style inconsistencies that should be removed.

output_examples.input: Remove AI slop from this branch
output: Identified 12 unnecessary comments explaining obvious code
Removed 5 redundant try/catch blocks on validated inputs
Standardized naming to match project conventions
Code reduced by 47 lines while preserving all functionality
Review changes before committing to ensure accuracy

best_practices: Review all suggested changes before applying to verify functionality is preserved
Run existing tests after cleanup to confirm no regressions
Make incremental changes and validate each step when cleaning large files
anti_patterns: Removing legitimate error handling along with defensive bloat
Applying cleanup without understanding the original code context
Expecting the skill to fix logic errors or architectural problems

faq.question: Which AI tools is this skill compatible with?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for any AI-assisted coding workflow.

faq.question: What patterns does this skill identify?
faq.answer: It detects unnecessary comments, defensive bloat, type workarounds, style inconsistencies, and AI tells.

faq.question: How does this integrate with my workflow?
faq.answer: Use after AI coding sessions. The skill analyzes code and suggests edits you apply manually.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a documentation-only skill. No code is transmitted externally or stored anywhere.

faq.question: Why is code quality worse after AI coding?
faq.answer: AI tends toward defensive patterns and verbose explanations. This skill removes that over-engineering.

faq.question: How is this different from a linter?
faq.answer: Linters enforce rules. This skill identifies AI-specific patterns that degrade readability and maintainability.
